member.summary: Extension methods provided by the JWT bearer token middleware.

member.name: M:Owin.JwtBearerAuthenticationExtensions.UseJwtBearerAuthentication(Owin.IAppBuilder,Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt.JwtBearerAuthenticationOptions)
member.summary: Adds JWT bearer token middleware to your web application pipeline.
member.param: The IAppBuilder passed to your configuration method.
An options class that controls the middleware behavior.

member.summary: Options for JWT Bearer Token handler configuration.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt.JwtBearerAuthenticationOptions.AllowedAudiences
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed audiences an inbound JWT will be checked against.

member.summary: Gets or sets the issuer security token providers which provide the signing keys a JWT signature is checked against.

member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication provider.

member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication realm.

member.summary: Gets or sets the used to determine if a token is valid.

member.summary: A System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler designed for creating and validating Json Web Tokens.

member.summary: Transforms the specified authentication ticket into a JWT.
member.param: The authentication ticket to transform into a JWT.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt.JwtFormat.Unprotect(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the specified JWT and builds an AuthenticationTicket from it.
member.exception: Thrown if the is not a JWT.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt.JwtFormat.ValidateIssuer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether JWT issuers should be validated.
member.value: true if the issuer should be validate; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt.JwtFormat.TokenHandler
member.summary: A System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler designed for creating and validating Json Web Tokens.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt.JwtFormat.UseTokenLifetime
member.summary: Indicates that the authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token. If the token does not provide lifetime information then normal session lifetimes will be used. This is enabled by default.
